text:
Viewing a directory index where some files and/or directories contain umlaut
characters (here, the Swedish characters å = å, ä = ä, ö = ö, Å
= Å, Ä = Ä, Ö = Ö) causes "column" misalignment in fancy
indexing output compared to "normal" files/directories in the same listing.

"Last modified" column and everything to the right gets pulled one character to
the left compared with the files/directories that do not contain any umlaut
characters.

The configuration for fancy indexing used is:
IndexOptions DescriptionWidth=* FancyIndexing FoldersFirst IgnoreCase
ScanHTMLTitles TrackModified VersionSort

See example below:

                                Index of /test

 Icon   Name                    Last modified      Size  Description
  __________________________________________________________________________
 [DIR]  Parent Directory                             -
 [DIR]  Dir2 with Ä/           05-Aug-2003 22:10    -
 [DIR]  Dir2 with Å/           05-Aug-2003 22:10    -
 [DIR]  Dir2 with Ö/           05-Aug-2003 22:10    -
 [DIR]  Dir with ä/            05-Aug-2003 22:00    -
 [DIR]  Dir with å/            05-Aug-2003 22:00    -
 [DIR]  Dir with ö/            05-Aug-2003 22:01    -
 [DIR]  Normal dir/             05-Aug-2003 22:07    -
 [TXT]  Another file.txt        05-Aug-2003 22:07    0   Text file
 [TXT]  File ä.txt             05-Aug-2003 22:04    0   Text file
 [TXT]  File å.txt             05-Aug-2003 22:04    0   Text file
 [TXT]  File ö.txt             05-Aug-2003 22:04    0   Text file
 [TXT]  File2 Ä.txt            05-Aug-2003 22:10    0   Text file
 [TXT]  File2 Å.txt            05-Aug-2003 22:10    0   Text file
 [TXT]  File2 Ö.txt            05-Aug-2003 22:10    0   Text file
 [TXT]  Normal file.txt         05-Aug-2003 22:04    0   Text file
